verses.verse: “For his letters,” they say, “are weighty and powerful, but (1 Cor. 2:3, 4; 2 Cor. 12:7; Gal. 4:13) his bodily presence is weak, and his ((1 Cor. 1:17); 2 Cor. 11:6) speech contemptible.”
Let such a person consider this, that what we are in word by letters when we are absent, such we will also be in deed when we are present.

Limits of Paul’s Authority (2 Cor. 5:12) For we dare not class ourselves or compare ourselves with those who commend themselves. But they, measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.
(2 Cor. 10:15) We, however, will not boast beyond measure, but within the limits of the sphere which God appointed us—a sphere which especially includes you.
For we are not overextending ourselves (as though our authority did not extend to you), (1 Cor. 3:5, 6) for it was to you that we came with the gospel of Christ;
not boasting of things beyond measure, that is, (Rom. 15:20) in other men’s labors, but having hope, that as your faith is increased, we shall be greatly enlarged by you in our sphere,
to preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man’s sphere of accomplishment.
But (Is. 65:16; Jer. 9:24; 1 Cor. 1:31) “he who glories, let him glory in the LORD.”
For (Prov. 27:2) not he who commends himself is approved, but (Rom. 2:29; (1 Cor. 4:5)) whom the Lord commends.
Concern for Their Faithfulness Oh, that you would bear with me in a little (Matt. 17:17; 2 Cor. 11:4, 16, 19) folly—and indeed you do bear with me.

For I am (Gal. 4:17) jealous for you with godly jealousy. For (Hos. 2:19; (Eph. 5:26)) I have betrothed you to one husband, (Col. 1:28) that I may present you (Lev. 21:13) as a chaste virgin to Christ.

But I fear, lest somehow, as (Gen. 3:4, 13; John 8:44; 1 Thess. 3:5; 1 Tim. 2:14; (Rev. 12:9, 15)) the serpent deceived Eve by his craftiness, so your minds (Eph. 6:24) may be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.

For if he who comes preaches another Jesus whom we have not preached, or if you receive a different spirit which you have not received, or a (Gal. 1:6-8) different gospel which you have not accepted—you may well put up with it!
Paul and False Apostles For I consider that ((1 Cor. 15:10); 2 Cor. 12:11; Gal. 2:6) I am not at all inferior to the most eminent apostles.
Even though ((1 Cor. 1:17)) I am untrained in speech, yet I am not ((1 Cor. 12:8; Eph. 3:4)) in knowledge. But ((2 Cor. 12:12)) we have been thoroughly manifested among you in all things.
Did I commit sin in humbling myself that you might be exalted, because I preached the gospel of God to you (Acts 18:3; 1 Cor. 9:18; 2 Cor. 12:13) free of charge?
I robbed other churches, taking wages from them to minister to you.

And when I was present with you, and in need, (Acts 20:33) I was a burden to no one, for what I lacked (Phil. 4:10) the brethren who came from Macedonia supplied. And in everything I kept myself from being burdensome to you, and so I will keep myself.
(Rom. 1:9; 9:1; 2 Cor. 1:23; (Gal. 2:20)) As the truth of Christ is in me, (1 Cor. 9:15) no one shall stop me from this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
Why? (2 Cor. 6:11; 12:15) Because I do not love you? God knows!
But what I do, I will also continue to do, (1 Cor. 9:12) that I may cut off the opportunity from those who desire an opportunity to be regarded just as we are in the things of which they boast.
For such (Acts 15:24; Rom. 16:18; Gal. 1:7; Phil. 1:15; 2 Pet. 2:1; Rev. 2:2) are false apostles, (Phil. 3:2; Titus 1:10) deceitful workers, transforming themselves into apostles of Christ.
And no wonder! For Satan himself transforms himself into (Gal. 1:8) an angel of light.
Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers also transform themselves into ministers of righteousness, ((Phil. 3:19)) whose end will be according to their works.
Reluctant Boasting I say again, let no one think me a fool. If otherwise, at least receive me as a fool, that I also may boast a little.
What I speak, (1 Cor. 7:6) I speak not according to the Lord, but as it were, foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.
Seeing that many boast according to the flesh, I also will boast.
For you put up with fools gladly, (1 Cor. 4:10) since you yourselves are wise!
For you put up with it (2 Cor. 1:24; (Gal. 2:4; 4:3, 9; 5:1)) if one brings you into bondage, if one devours you, if one takes from you, if one exalts himself, if one strikes you on the face.
To our shame (2 Cor. 10:10) I say that we were too weak for that! But (Phil. 3:4) in whatever anyone is bold—I speak foolishly—I am bold also.
Suffering for Christ Are they (Acts 22:3; Rom. 11:1; Phil. 3:4-6) Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? So am I.
Are they ministers of Christ?—I speak as a fool—I am more: (1 Cor. 15:10) in labors more abundant, (Acts 9:16) in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequently, (1 Cor. 15:30) in deaths often.
From the Jews five times I received (Deut. 25:3) forty (2 Cor. 6:5) stripes minus one.
